senses.de: Present in large quantities; more than enough
senses.ex: Fresh fruits and vegetables are abundant in summer.

Tips.title: Natural Occurrences
Tips.description: Often used to describe nature's generosity, like harvests or wildlife.
Tips.example: During spring, the abundant blossoms attract numerous bees.

Tips.title: Positive Connotation
Tips.description: Implies a beneficial aspect, such as having ample resources.
Tips.example: The new library had an abundant collection of books.

Tips.title: Quantitative Measurement
Tips.description: Can describe something measurable, not just a vague plenty.
Tips.example: Researchers found abundant evidence to support the theory.

senses.de: Wealthy; having a lot of money or possessions
senses.ex: He led an abundant lifestyle, always surrounded by luxuries.

Tips.title: Financial Abundance
Tips.description: Refers to a substantial amount of wealth, not just getting by.
Tips.example: The entrepreneur enjoyed an abundant fortune from his investments.

Tips.title: Lifestyle Quality
Tips.description: Implies a high quality of life with plenty of comforts.
Tips.example: She enjoyed an abundant lifestyle with frequent vacations.

Tips.title: Not Just Money
Tips.description: Abundance can refer to possessions or assets, not only cash.
Tips.example: They lived in a home abundant with fine art and antiques.

senses.ex: Her songs are abundant in emotion and meaning.

Tips.title: Metaphysical Use
Tips.description: Poetically describes things filled with a certain quality or essence.
Tips.example: The novel's language was abundant with vivid imagery.

Tips.title: Emotional Depth
Tips.description: Can show a deep presence of feelings or characteristics.
Tips.example: Their reunion was abundant with joy and laughter.

Tips.title: Cultural Richness
Tips.description: Used to express the richness found in cultural aspects.
Tips.example: The festival was abundant in color and tradition.

Ample.wordDefinition:
Both words, abundant and ample, describe the quantity or amount of something.

For example, a forest can be described as abundant if it has a lot of trees in it.

Ample means the quantity is enough or sufficient for the purpose required. So, when something is ample, it means that it is enough or adequate.

For example, if you have ample time to complete your homework, it means you have enough time to finish it without rushing.

Abundant is used when you want to emphasize that there is more than enough of something, while ample describes when the quantity is enough or sufficient for what is needed.

Bountiful.wordDefinition:
The words abundant and bountiful are both used to describe something that is plentiful or plentifully supplied.

However, abundant is used more to describe an extensive amount, while bountiful is used more to describe generosity or a gift.

For example, you would say abundant crops because there is a large amount of them. But you would say a bountiful harvest as it implies that it is a gift or a generous amount.

Abundant is used for more general contexts of being ample, while bountiful is often used in the context of a gift or generosity.

Copious.wordDefinition:
Abundant and copious are synonyms, which means that they have similar meanings. Both refer to something that is existing or available in large quantities.

Copious is often used to describe something that is not only plentiful, but also more than what is necessary or expected.

For example, you might use the word copious to describe a copious amount of notes that someone took during a lecture, implying that they took an excessive amount of notes.

Similarly, you might say that someone has a copious vocabulary, meaning that they know an impressive amount of words.

In summary, both abundant and copious mean that there is a lot of something, but copious implies an excess or abundance that goes beyond what is usual or necessary.

Generous.wordDefinition:
Abundant means having a lot of something, while generous means someone who likes to share what they have. For example, if you have an abundant amount of fruit, it means you have a lot of it.

If you are generous, it means you like to share what you have, whether it's money, food or time. Abundant describes quantities while generous describes the nature of an individual.

Overflow.wordDefinition:
Overflow refers to having an excess or surplus of something.

It is used when you have more than what you need or can handle. For example, a basin can overflow with water, or a person's schedule can overflow with too many commitments.

Abundant means having plenty, while overflow means having too much.

Plentiful.wordDefinition:
Both words, abundant and plentiful, share similarities in meaning, but they have a slight difference in their usage.

Abundant suggests that there is a plentiful amount of something in general, but not necessarily in a specific place or at a specific time.

Plentiful describes a sufficient amount of something that is available in a specific place or at a specific time. For example, we can say that food is plentiful at a party, which means that there is a sufficient amount of food at that specific location and time.

Abundant is used for general things in general terms, while plentiful describes enough things in specific terms.

Profuse.wordDefinition:
Both abundant and profuse mean "a lot of something".

Profuse is used when there is a lot of something and it feels excessive or overwhelming.

For example, a garden that has an abundant amount of flowers would be well-maintained and pleasing to the eyes. A garden with profuse flowers might be overcrowded and have a messy appearance.

Abundant suggests a satisfactory amount, while profuse suggests an excess amount.

Rich.wordDefinition:
Rich, on the other hand, refers to having a lot of wealth or possessions.

It is typically used to describe people who have a high net worth or own many valuable things, such as a millionaire who is considered to be very rich.

Abundant is applicable when talking about resources or natural things, while rich is applicable when talking about wealth or possessions.

quotes.Text: One thing that has become abundantly clear to me as I have advocated for the health and well-being of girls and women over the years is the innate power we each have within us to establish deep connection with one another and heal ourselves simply by sharing our stories.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Christy Turlington

quotes.Text: If you believe, like I do, that the world is abundant with possibilities, then we need to make sure we build capacity so that everybody is successful or can be successful in the pursuit of their dreams - not the dreams of someone from government, but their own dreams.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jeb Bush

quotes.Text: Art is only a means to life, to the life more abundant. It is not in itself the life more abundant. It merely points the way, something which is overlooked not only by the public, but very often by the artist himself. In becoming an end it defeats itself.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Henry Miller

quotes.Text: I've been very passionate about renewable energy for many years, particularly solar energy and its capacity to bring abundant clean, sustainable energy to millions around the globe.
quotes.Title: British Businessman
quotes.Name: Richard Branson

quotes.Text: Apply yourself both now and in the next life. Without effort, you cannot be prosperous. Though the land be good, You cannot have an abundant crop without cultivation.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Plato

quotes.Text: You may take great comfort from the fact that suffering inwardly for the sake of truth proves abundantly that one loves it and marks one out as being of the elect.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Ernest Renan

quotes.Text: Life is abundant, and life is beautiful. And it's a good place that we're all in, you know, on this earth, if we take care of it.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Alice Walker

quotes.Text: Lose yourself in generous service and every day can be a most unusual day, a triumphant day, an abundantly rewarding day!
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: William Arthur Ward

quotes.Text: To love abundantly is to live abundantly, and to love forever is to live forever.
quotes.Title: Scottish Writer
quotes.Name: Henry Drummond

quotes.Text: I live in an abundant universe where anything is possible.
quotes.Title: American Rapper
quotes.Name: NLE Choppa
